title: Typhoon unlikely to end Ireland's World Cup with contingency plans in place if Samoa game is cancelled
text:
The chances of Ireland exiting the Rugby World Cup due to a typhoon appear to be minimal with World Rugby able to go to a contingency plan should their match against Samoa on Saturday have to be cancelled. It is understood the match could be postponed by 24hrs if necessary.

Typhoon Hagibis has formed in the Western Pacific Ocean to the south of Japan, with forecasts suggesting it could hit the island of Kyushu – including the city of Fukuoka – this weekend.

Ireland are due to play Samoa in their final Pool A game on Saturday at 7.45pm local time (11.45am in the UK).

Officially, any games cancelled at the World Cup due to weather problems are registered as scoreless draws.

That scenario would...
description: The chances of Ireland exiting the Rugby World Cup due to a typhoon appear to be minimal with World Rugby able to go to a contingency plan should their match against Samoa on Saturday have to be cancelled.
